24 years after the Brady Bill was signed into law, we don't know how many, but it's a good bet it has saved many American lives.

Yet right after the worst mass shooting of our time, the gun lobby is pushing a bill to weaken gun safety laws. That's a terrible idea. #StopCCRhttps://twitter.com/BradyCenter/status/936297546280030208 …

"We share grave concerns about any official in the White House with a position of influence over national security who knew about, or even participated in, covert arrangements designed to help a foreign adversary of the United States subvert our democratic elections processes."pic.twitter.com/UiwXw3g3Kq

Our questions to Stephen Miller after Papadopoulos revelations:

What did you know about Russia's efforts to help Trump win, and when?

Who did you tell, and what actions did you take?

Did you disclose all Russia meetings and contacts on your SF-86 security clearance form?pic.twitter.com/iZQwjF3AXY
None of this is true. What Trump did is disgusting and the White House's spin is farcically bad.https://twitter.com/atrupar/status/936332380100587521 …

We need more women in positions of leadership in communities, businesses, and government. 

I've been working on that since I got to Congress, and I will continue those efforts. Virginia's elevation of women in elected leadership this month is a good sign.

Congress must pass @RepSpeier's #MeToo Act, which would reform policies in Congress to improve the process for complaints, add transparency, give victims access to counsel without forcing them to be silenced, and require lawmakers rather than taxpayers to pay damages.

Every victim of sexual assault should feel safe coming forward and have an avenue for redress. We must have systems focused on protecting victims and preventing assault.

I voted for a bill yesterday which would mandate sexual harassment training in Congress, but it isn't enough.

Those who commit these offenses must be held accountable, no matter how powerful they are.

Congress cannot be exempt, and I believe that Congressman John Conyers should resign.

Right now our country is undertaking a much-overdue reckoning with sexual harassment and assault.

This has long been a serious problem, and Congress should take a leading role and help usher in change to protect victims and change our culture for the better.

What did Stephen Miller know about contacts and meetings with Russians as they offered support to the Trump campaign?

When did he know it? Who else did he tell? What actions did he take?

Did he disclose this knowledge on his SF-86 to obtain a security clearance?

Our questions arise from revelations that George Papadopoulos informed Stephen Miller and other Trump campaign officials about Russian offers of assistance.

Miller is still in the White House, with a security clearance and access to sensitive classified information.https://twitter.com/RepDonBeyer/status/936268588742336514 …

NEW: I led House Dems pressing White House Senior Advisor Stephen Miller to answer questions on disclosures of Russia's offers of support to the Trump campaign.

It is more popular than ever now because we got so much right with it. The ACA is a strong starting point. 

Let's make it stronger. 12/12

Does this system sound familiar? It's called the Affordable Care Act.

It's not perfect, but we can make it better w/ bipartisan action. 11/
Most importantly, you could design your policy on the basis of recognition of the fact that health care is a right, not a privilege. 10/
You could ensure that being a woman is no longer treated as a preexisting condition, exposing women to unfair healthcare costs. 9/
You could make sure insurers can't jack up premiums too far or spend too much of their money on things that aren't health care. 8/
You could make preventative services, like physicals and mammograms, free. It would improve health and lower overall costs. 7/
You could close the "donut hole" to give seniors the assistance they need to afford prescription drugs. 6/
You could shrink coverage gaps among people just above the poverty line by expanding Medicaid, a program well liked by its recipients... 5/
You could help families by allowing young people to stay on parents' insurance until they are old enough to earn benefits. Say 26 yrs old 4/

Many others worked to #FreeAya, they all deserve thanks for fighting for justice.

Getting the news that Aya would go free was pure joy. 10/
We were heard. @SamanthaJPower spoke up. @JohnKerry, the @ObamaWhiteHouse & former Sec of State @HillaryClinton pressed Egypt to #FreeAya 9/
Congress spoke up, including @timkaine @MarkWarner @RepEliotEngel @SenatorCardin @marcorubio @SenatorLeahy @RosLehtinen @SenatorDurbin 8/
They worked w Congress. I wrote @JohnKerry, reached out to @StateDept officials, & held a press confrnce w @GerryConnolly to say #FreeAya! 7
Human rights NGO's spoke up too: @TimepDC @ColeBockenfeld, @TimepDC @appyati, @HRW, @amnesty & others came together to raise Aya's case 7/
Human rights advocate @soltanlife, who had been imprisoned in Egypt, advised the family. Friends from @SCARatGMU @CabreraAngel spoke out 6/
Aya's family - her mother Naglaa, sister Alaa, & brother Basel - worked w  counsel, @maitelsadany @RFKHumanRights @wademc @KerryKennedyRFK
But over time, a group came together to push Egypt to release her, and to urge the US government to apply pressure to Egyptian officials 4/

..along w several coworkers.

Aya was held for 3 yrs with multiple trial delays & postponements. Her imprisonment was unjust & indefinite 3/
They founded Belady to care for displaced children, but it was hit by Egypt's 2014 crackdown on NGOs & civil society. They were arrested 2/
Aya Hijazi grew up in @FallsChurchGov, & studied at @SCARatGMU. After she graduated, she went to Cairo, where she met her husband Mohamed 1/https://twitter.com/RepDonBeyer/status/853987943396102144 …
